title: angels
comment: Spiritual beings who assist God, especially in his work of salvation, conveying his word to human beings and attending to the needs of God's people.

children.title: angels, as God's servants
children.comment: Angels have specific yet limited roles to play in declaring God's will and purposes for humanity.

children.title: Angels are God's servants
Named angels
Angels as agents of God's salvation
Angels do not fully understand God's salvation
Angels deliver God's people from their enemies
Angels as mediators

primaryrefs.comment: The law was mediated by angels to Moses and Israel

children.title: Angels as revealers of God's will
Angels convey and fulfil God's instructions
Angels attend to the needs of God's people
Angels provide food at special times
Angels provide protection
Angels give guidance
Angels serve Jesus Christ
Angels care for Jesus Christ's needs
Angels are ready to protect Jesus Christ
Angels are inferior to Jesus Christ
angels, as God's messengers
children.comment: Spiritual messengers with the special role of making known God's work of salvation.

children.title: Angels give hope through the words of the prophets

primaryrefs.comment: The voice in this passage may be that of an angel.

children.title: Angels and the coming of the Messiah
An angel foretells the birth of John the Baptist
Angels foretell Jesus Christ's birth
Angels announce Jesus Christ's birth
Angels announce Jesus Christ's resurrection
Angels foretell Jesus Christ's second coming
Angels reveal the gospel for the Gentiles
Angels foretell God's final triumph
angels, as agents of God's judgment
children.comment: Spiritual beings who assist God in carrying out his judgments. Angels will be especially active when Jesus Christ returns for the last judgment.

children.title: Angels as agents of earthly judgments
Against Sodom and Gomorrah
Against opponents of God
Against Israel
Against Herod Antipas
Angels restrained by God's mercy
Angels and final judgment
Angels proclaim God's sovereignty
Angels announce God's final invitation
Angels hold back the final judgment
Angels carry out preliminary warning judgments
Angels accompany Jesus Christ when he returns to judge
Angels gather everyone for the final judgment
Angels announce the final judgment
Angels enact the final judgment
Angels are subject to judgment
angels, and praise of God
children.comment: Spiritual beings who praise God in a manner that is beyond human capacity.

children.title: Angels worship God in his presence
Angels praise God for his works
Angels praise God's work of creation
Angels praise God's work of redemption

primaryrefs.comment: The angels are praising God for Jesus Christ's birth.

children.title: Angels praise God's kingdom
Angelic beings praise God
Thousands of angels worship God
Images of angelic beings decorate Israel's sanctuaries

seealsos.comment: The images of the cherubim represent the angels who worship God in heaven.

children.title: Angels are not to be worshipped
angel, of the Lord
angels, opposed to God
children.comment: Spiritual beings who fell with Satan. They are under God's judgment and are subject to the authority of believers.

children.title: Spiritual authorities led by Satan
Angels opposed to God will be judged
Jesus Christ has defeated Satan and his angels
Satan's angels are resisted by God's faithful angels

seealsos.comment: The princes of Persia and Greece appear to be spiritual powers who resist God's rule over these regions.

children.title: Jesus Christ gives authority over Satan and his angels to believers
